title: Clean Your Kit
description: Your armor's caked with mud and blood. Scrub it down before the sergeant sees.

success.text: Your gear gleams in the firelight. The sergeant gives you a satisfied nod.

failure.text: You half-arsed the job. The sergeant makes you do it again while the others eat.

decline.text: 'Too good to clean your own armor?' The sergeant's glare promises latrine duty.

title: Night Watch
description: Stand watch through the night. Keep your eyes sharp and your blade ready.

success.text: A quiet night. The sergeant commends your vigilance as dawn breaks.

failure.text: You dozed off at your post. A kicked bucket woke the camp. The shame burns.

decline.text: 'Too tired for watch duty?' The sergeant's voice drips with contempt.

title: Fetch Water
description: The water barrels are running low. Haul buckets from the stream.

success.text: Your shoulders ache, but the barrels are full. The men nod their thanks.

failure.text: You spilled half the water on the way back. Now you'll make twice as many trips.

decline.text: The others mutter as they haul water in your stead. You've made enemies today.

title: Blade Practice
description: The lieutenant wants the men sharp. Practice cuts and thrusts until your arms burn.

success.text: Your blade sings through the air. The lieutenant calls you out as an example.

failure.text: You're sloppy and slow. The lieutenant makes you drill alone while the others rest.

decline.text: 'Arms too tired?' The lieutenant's sneer cuts deeper than any blade.

title: Walk the Perimeter
description: Take two men and patrol the camp's edge. Watch for bandits or wolves.

success.text: You circle the camp twice. Nothing stirs but the wind. Your men trust you more.

failure.text: You missed a gap in the pickets. The sergeant finds it on his own rounds. He's not pleased.

decline.text: Someone else will walk the cold night in your place. They won't forget it.

title: Tend the Horses
description: The mounts need brushing and feeding. The stablemaster is shouting for help.

success.text: The horses are fed and brushed. A few of the men clap you on the shoulder.

failure.text: You spooked one of the warhorses. It kicked over a feed barrel. The stablemaster curses your name.

decline.text: The sergeant marks you down as too proud for honest work. Bad sign.

title: Gather Firewood
description: Take an axe and two men. We need wood for the night's fires.

success.text: You haul back enough wood for three fires. The camp will be warm tonight.

failure.text: You brought back green wood that won't burn. The men huddle cold around smoking fires.

decline.text: Your brothers shiver in the cold while you sat idle. They remember.

title: Carry the Message
description: The captain needs a message carried to the allied camp, an hour's march east.

success.text: You deliver the message and return before sunset. The captain is satisfied.

failure.text: You got turned around in the woods. By the time you found the camp, the message was useless.

decline.text: 'Find someone with courage,' the lieutenant snaps. Your name is mud.

title: Practice Formations
description: The sergeant wants the shield wall tight. Drill with your squad until he's satisfied.

success.text: Your line holds like iron. The sergeant actually smiles. The lads buy you ale tonight.

failure.text: You broke the line. The sergeant makes the whole squad run laps. No one's happy with you.

decline.text: A man who won't drill won't fight. The squad doesn't want you in their line.

title: Strike the Tents
description: We march at dawn. Help break down the camp and load the wagons.

success.text: The tents are down and packed before the horn sounds. The march begins on time.

failure.text: You tangled the tent ropes and dropped a pole on a wagon. We're late leaving.

decline.text: The others work while you stand idle. The sergeant puts you on latrine duty for a week.

title: Teach the Greenhorns
description: New recruits joined the company. Show them how to hold a spear without killing themselves.

success.text: The lads pick it up quick. One calls you 'sir' before catching himself. You feel pride.

failure.text: You lost patience and barked at them like a dog. They're more confused than before.

decline.text: 'Too important to train the new blood?' The sergeant's tone says you're not as good as you think.

title: Inspect the Gear
description: Check your squad's weapons and armor. Report anything broken or missing.

success.text: You catch two cracked shields and a rusted buckle. The sergeant nods approval.

failure.text: You missed a split sword grip. It broke in the next fight. A man nearly died.

decline.text: The sergeant does the inspection himself. He remembers you refused.
